code: @Manual{,   title = {svatools: SWAT+ protocol tools},   author = {Svajunas Plunge},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/biopsichas/svatools}, }

title: SWAT+ protocol tools
text: goal svatools help SWAT+ input data preparation, visualisation model outpout data assessment.

title: SWAT+ protocol tools
text: can install development version svatools GitHub :

title: SWAT+ protocol tools
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(svatools) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

Main interpolation function — get_interpolated_data
text: Main interpolation function

title: Main interpolation function — get_interpolated_data
code: get_interpolated_data(   meteo_lst,   par,   catchment_boundary_path,   dem_data_path,   grid_spacing,   idw_exponent = 2 )

title: Main interpolation function — get_interpolated_data
text: meteo_lst nested list lists dataframes. Nested structure meteo_lst -> data -> Station ID -> Parameter -> Dataframe (DATE, PARAMETER). par character representing weather variable extract (.e. "PCP", "SLR", etc). catchment_boundary_path path basin boundary shape file. dem_data_path path DEM raster data projection weather station. grid_spacing numeric value distance grid. Units coordinate system used. idw_exponent numeric value exponent parameter used interpolation. (optional, default value 2).

code: temp_path <- system.file("templates", "weather_data.xlsx", package = "svatools") load_stations(temp_path, 4326) #> Simple feature collection with 13 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 4870219 ymin: 3267468 xmax: 4941373 ymax: 3360044 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Warning: bounding box has potentially an invalid value range for longlat data #> # A tibble: 13 × 7 #>    ID    Name             Eleva…¹ Source          geometry     Long      Lat #>  * <chr> <chr>            <chr>   <chr>        <POINT [°]>    <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 ID1   RUDZK DUZY       98.7    ODR    (4892472 3300305) 4892472. 3300305. #>  2 ID2   GLEBOKIE         85.0    IMGW   (4891414 3315522) 4891414. 3315522. #>  3 ID3   GLODOWO          99.0    IMGW   (4941373 3342216) 4941373. 3342216. #>  4 ID4   SOBIESIERNIE     80.0    IMGW   (4890114 3326585) 4890114. 3326585. #>  5 ID5   SOMPOLNO         89.0    IMGW   (4899376 3286548) 4899376. 3286548. #>  6 ID6   STARY BRZESC     76.0    IMGW   (4922989 3315576) 4922989. 3315576. #>  7 ID7   WANDOWO          99.0    IMGW   (4884100 3290379) 4884100. 3290379. #>  8 ID8   DOBRE            89.0    ODR    (4898808 3320131) 4898808. 3320131. #>  9 ID9   SAMSZYCE         84      ITP    (4908664 3312471) 4908664. 3312471. #> 10 ID10  KOLO-RADOSZEWICE 109     IMGW   (4912727 3285804) 4912727. 3285804. #> 11 ID11  TORUN            69      IMGW   (4895994 3360044) 4895994. 3360044. #> 12 ID12  KOLUDA WIELKA    84      IMGW   (4870219 3322437) 4870219. 3322437. #> 13 ID13  KOLO             117     IMGW   (4911580 3267468) 4911580. 3267468. #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​Elevation

https://swat.tamu.edu/media/41583/wgen-excel.zip — write_wgnmaker_files

Preparing input files for WGNmaker. WGNmaker excel macro could be downloaded from following link:
https://swat.tamu.edu/media/41583/wgen-excel.zip — write_wgnmaker_files
text: write_path path folder results written. meteo_lst nested list lists dataframes. Nested structure meteo_lst -> data -> Station ID -> Parameter -> Dataframe (DATE, PARAMETER). wgn_stations_lst List selected stations parameter used data preparation. Example list(PCP = "ID12",  SLR = "ID11", RELHUM = "ID12", TMP_MAX = "ID12", TMP_MIN = "ID12", WNDSPD = "ID12", MAXHHR = "ID12") station_name string name station.

code: plot_weather_fig_compare(   meteo_lst1,   meteo_lst2,   par,   period = "day",   fn_summarize = "mean",   name_set1 = "raw",   name_set2 = "clean" )

title: Plotting figure to comparing two datasets with weather data — plot_weather_fig_compare
text: meteo_lst1 first nested list lists dataframes. Nested structure meteo_lst -> data -> Station ID -> Parameter -> Dataframe (DATE, PARAMETER). meteo_lst2 second nested list lists dataframes. Nested structure meteo_lst -> data -> Station ID -> Parameter -> Dataframe (DATE, PARAMETER). par character marking weather variable extract (.e. "PCP", "SLR", etc). period character describing, time interval display (default "day", examples "week", "month", etc). fn_summarize function recalculate time interval (default "mean", examples "median", "sum", etc). name_set1 character name first dataset. name_set2 character name second dataset.
